member.summary: This GUID is used to identify all WPD driver events to the event sub-system. The driver uses this as the GUID identifier when it queues an event with IWdfDevice::PostEvent(). Applications never use this value.

member.name: F:MediaDevices.Events.ObjectAdded
member.summary: This event is sent after a new object is available on the device.

member.summary: This event is sent after a previously existing object has been removed from the device.

member.name: F:MediaDevices.Events.ObjectUpdated
member.summary: This event is sent after an object has been updated such that any connected client should refresh its view of that object.

member.name: F:MediaDevices.Events.DeviceReset
member.summary: This event indicates that the device is about to be reset, and all connected clients should close their connection to the device.

member.name: F:MediaDevices.Events.DeviceCapabilitiesUpdated
member.summary: This event indicates that the device capabilities have changed. Clients should re-query the device if they have made any decisions based on device capabilities.

member.name: F:MediaDevices.Events.StorageFormat
member.summary: This event indicates the progress of a format operation on a storage object.

member.name: F:MediaDevices.Events.ObjectTransferRequest
member.summary: This event is sent to request an application to transfer a particular object from the device.

member.name: F:MediaDevices.Events.DeviceRemoved
member.summary: This event is sent when a driver for a device is being unloaded. This is typically a result of the device being unplugged.

member.name: F:MediaDevices.Events.ServiceMethodComplete
member.summary: This event is sent when a driver has completed invoking a service method. This event must be sent even when the method fails.

member.name: F:MediaDevices.Internal.HResult.ERROR_NOT_FOUND
member.summary: May be used to indicate that the device supports a property, but that property value is currently empty or uninitialized. May be used to indicate that the internal context for a long-running operation no longer exists, as the operation has completed or has been cancelled. Examples of such operations include bulk properties, object enumeration, transfer, and invoking device service methods. Applications should retry the operation from the beginning. May be used to indicate that the specified object does not exist. The child object may be outside of the device service hierarchy.

member.summary: This event indicates the progress of a format operation on a storage object.

member.summary: This event is sent to request an application to transfer a particular object from the device.

member.name: E:MediaDevices.MediaDevice.DeviceRemoved
member.summary: This event is sent when a driver for a device is being unloaded. This is typically a result of the device being unplugged.

member.name: E:MediaDevices.MediaDevice.ServiceMethodComplete
member.summary: This event is sent when a driver has completed invoking a service method. This event must be sent even when the method fails.

member.summary: Returns an enumerable collection of directory information that matches a specified search pattern and search subdirectory option.

member.name: T:MediaDevices.MediaDeviceShare
member.summary: Specifies the share mode the client is requesting to this device.

member.name: F:MediaDevices.MediaDeviceShare.Default
member.summary: Use the default value.

member.name: F:MediaDevices.MediaDeviceShare.Read
member.summary: Enables subsequent open operations on a file or device to request read access. Otherwise, other processes cannot open the file or device if they request read access. If this flag is not specified, but the file or device has been opened for read access, the function fails.

member.name: F:MediaDevices.MediaDeviceShare.Write
member.summary: Enables subsequent open operations on a file or device to request write access. Otherwise, other processes cannot open the file or device if they request write access. If this flag is not specified, but the file or device has been opened for write access or has a file mapping with write access, the function fails.

member.name: F:MediaDevices.MediaDeviceShare.Delete
member.summary: Enables subsequent open operations on a file or device to request delete access. Otherwise, other processes cannot open the file or device if they request delete access. If this flag is not specified, but the file or device has been opened for delete access, the function fails.

member.summary: Returns an enumerable collection of directory information in the current directory.

member.name: M:MediaDevices.MediaDirectoryInfo.EnumerateDirectories(System.String,System.IO.SearchOption)
member.summary: Returns an enumerable collection of directory information that matches a specified search pattern and search subdirectory option.
member.param: The search string to match against the names of directories. This parameter can contain a combination of valid literal path and wildcard (* and ?) characters, but doesn't support regular expressions. The default pattern is "*", which returns all files.
One of the enumeration values that specifies whether the search operation should include only the current directory or all subdirectories. The default value is TopDirectoryOnly.
member.returns: An enumerable collection of directories that matches searchPattern and searchOption.

member.name: M:MediaDevices.MediaDirectoryInfo.EnumerateFiles
member.summary: Returns an enumerable collection of file information in the current directory.
member.returns: An enumerable collection of the files in the current directory.

member.name: M:MediaDevices.MediaDirectoryInfo.EnumerateFiles(System.String,System.IO.SearchOption)
member.summary: Returns an enumerable collection of file information that matches a specified search pattern and search subdirectory option.
member.param: The search string to match against the names of files. This parameter can contain a combination of valid literal path and wildcard (* and ?) characters, but doesn't support regular expressions. The default pattern is "*", which returns all files.
One of the enumeration values that specifies whether the search operation should include only the current directory or all subdirectories. The default value is TopDirectoryOnly.
member.returns: An enumerable collection of files that matches searchPattern and searchOption.

member.name: M:MediaDevices.MediaDirectoryInfo.EnumerateFileSystemInfos
member.summary: Returns an enumerable collection of file system information in the current directory.
member.returns: An enumerable collection of file system information in the current directory.

member.name: M:MediaDevices.MediaDirectoryInfo.EnumerateFileSystemInfos(System.String,System.IO.SearchOption)
member.summary: Returns an enumerable collection of file system information that matches a specified search pattern and search subdirectory option.
member.param: The search string to match against the names of directories. This parameter can contain a combination of valid literal path and wildcard (* and ?) characters, but doesn't support regular expressions. The default pattern is "*", which returns all files.
One of the enumeration values that specifies whether the search operation should include only the current directory or all subdirectories. The default value is TopDirectoryOnly.
member.returns: An enumerable collection of file system information objects that matches searchPattern and searchOption.
